articles.title: Grok Responds After Elon Musk's AI Chatbot Appears to Praise Hitler
articles.author: Gabe Whisnant
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, has come under scrutiny following a series of controversial and since-deleted posts on X. The chatbot's account posted on Tuesday night, "We are aware of recent posts made by Grok and are actively working to remove the inappropriate posts." On Friday, Musk said xAI has "significantly improved @Grok" and users "should notice a difference"

articles.title: AI Agents Now Propel Software Market With Whopping 20% Expansion
articles.author: Frank Nez
articles.summary: The software market is poised for a 20% expansion driven by the increasing integration of artificial intelligence (AI) agents. Goldman Sachs reports that the integration of AI agents into workflows will redefine the user interface for knowledge workers and make software interactions more intuitive and efficient.

articles.title: Aehr Test Systems reports Q4 EPS (1c), two estimates (1c)
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Aehr Test Systems reports Q4 revenue of $14.1M. Backlog as of May 30, 2025 was $15.2M. Business expanded into new markets for test and burn-in, including artificial intelligence processors, gallium nitride power semiconductors, data storage devices and silicon photonics integrated circuits for optical chip-to-chip communication.

articles.title: Perplexity Comet
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Perplexity AI Comet is an advanced, AI-powered web browser built on the Chromium framework. It leverages both local and cloud-based AI models to deliver real-time, multimodal, and citation-supported answers. Comet supports text, voice, and image inputs. It delivers personalized, context-aware responses based on user preferences and browsing history. Comet is a Chromium-based browser.

articles.title: Chinese researchers unveil MemOS, the first ‘memory operating system' that gives AI human-like recall
articles.summary: MemOS is a new AI system developed by researchers from leading institutions. It is based on a three-layer design similar to computer operating systems. It provides a standardized memory format that can move between AI systems. MemOS is released as open source to accelerate adoption of the technology.

articles.title: Open, transparent AI models will create more innovation and trust
articles.author: Peter Wang
articles.summary: Today, most AI is being built on blind faith inside of black boxes. The industry is moving at warp speed, employing deep learning to tackle every problem, training on datasets that few people can trace, and hoping no one gets sued. The most popular AI models are developed behind closed doors, with unclear documentation, vague licensing, and limited visibility into the provenance of training data. Open source will foster innovation and lay a stronger foundation for civic discourse around AI policy and ethics.

articles.title: The AI Healthcare Challenge: Scaling Beyond the Pilot Phase
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) market is predicted to be worth $188 billion by 2030. There is an escalating demand for skilled AI professionals in healthcare. The cost of implementing AI solutions in healthcare is decreasing, making these technologies accessible to organizations of all sizes. The main challenge is scaling these solutions effectively and responsibly. There are data, infrastructure, regulation, and workforce adaptation issues.

articles.title: North Carolina deploys AI-powered traffic signal management software to 2,500 intersections
articles.author: Keely Quinlan
articles.summary: New AI-powered traffic signal management software was deployed to 2,500 intersections across North Carolina. The software is from the transportation technology company Flow Labs. It relies on data from the department's traffic cameras and GPS data from connected vehicles to improve traffic flow. Flow Labs CEO Jatish Patel said his company's AI makes processing large volumes of data much simpler and helps state agencies save money.

articles.title: Marco Rubio has an AI imposter.
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Someone impersonating the Secretary of State sent AI messages to foreign ministers, a US governor, and a Congress member. The person contacted the officials on the encrypted messaging app Signal and over text. A memo said the imposter 'likely aimed to manipulate targeted individuals with the goal of gaining access to information or accounts'

articles.title: Chinese researchers unveil MemOS, the first ‘memory operating system' that gives AI human-like recall
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: MemOS is the first 'memory operating system' for artificial intelligence. It treats memory as a core computational resource that can be scheduled, shared, and evolved over time. The research shows significant performance improvements over existing approaches, including 159% boost in temporal reasoning tasks compared to OpenAI's memory systems.

articles.title: Scientists Develop Robotic Skin That Enables Robots to Feel Touch and Temperature
articles.author: Greek Reporter
articles.summary: Robots can now feel touch, heat, and damage with advanced robotic skin. The material is not quite at the level where the robotic skin is as good as human skin, but it's better than anything else out there at the moment, according to the scientists.

articles.title: Junk Food for the Mind
articles.author: Jason Bowling Ssvec
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence gives people the impression that they can be good at thinking without hard work. A recent study exposes this seduction. It has a small sample size and hasn't even been peer reviewed yet, but it suggests something that seems intuitively true.

articles.title: Meta's Yann LeCun Defends Open-Source A.I. Amid Geopolitical Tension
articles.author: Rachel Curry
articles.summary: Yann LeCun is one of the godfathers of A.I. technology. He believes that open-source technology is safer and faster than restrictions on access to it. He also believes that large language models (LLMs) are not the path to achieving artificial superintelligence. He wants an international partnership to train foundation models collaboratively.

articles.title: Marco Rubio impersonated by AI imposter
articles.author: Jessi Turnure
articles.summary: Scam messages impersonating Marco Rubio tried to contact a U.S. senator, a governor and several foreign officials. The department said the messages were unsuccessful, but members of Congress stress this is just the latest example of why they need to pass AI regulations. There's still no agreement in Washington on the best ways to police AI.

articles.title: With almost 100 algorithms in use, Mayo Clinic aims to build AI 'into the fabric of Mayo'
articles.summary: At the AI Summit in Rochester, a group of physicians and scientists discussed how artificial intelligence is being used at Mayo Clinic. The theme of this year's two-day summit was "Generative AI, Information Retrieval & Evidence-Based Medicine" Mayo Clinic has announced a steady stream of newly developed medical AI tools in the past year.

articles.title: You Can Replace Supreme Court Lawyers With AI Now. Honestly, That Tracks.
articles.author: Joe Patrice
articles.summary: ChatGPT offered $1 million to use their AI system to argue a Supreme Court case. Jenner & Block's Adam Unikowsky used his own AI system Claude 4.0 Opus to argue Williams v. Reed. He used a synthetic ElevenLabs voice spliced in with the justices to create an audio track of the argument.

articles.title: AGI: A Fractured Definition Dividing Tech Giants
articles.summary: The pursuit of Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) remains a hotly debated topic among tech industry's leading players. Industry leaders have different views on AGI and different approaches to AI development. Google DeepMind, Microsoft, Meta, and Zhihu are investing heavily in AGI.

articles.title: C3 AI initiated with a Buy at WestPark Capital
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: WestPark Capital initiated coverage of C3 AI (AI) with a Buy rating and $40 price target. TipRanks' Half-Year Sale offers 50% off its premium service.    Tipranks' Smart Investor Picks are delivered to your inbox every week.

articles.title: Can ChatGPT actually 'see' red? New study results are nuanced
articles.author: Mike Mcnulty
articles.summary: ChatGPT works by analyzing vast amounts of text and synthesizing patterns to generate responses to users' prompts. The study's interdisciplinary team included psychologists, neuroscientists, social scientists, computer scientists and astrophysicists from UC San Diego, Stanford, Université de Montréal, the University of the West of England and Google DeepMind.

articles.title: OpenAI May Be in Major Trouble Financially
articles.summary: ChatGPT was launched two and a half years ago. OpenAI has raised at least $60.9 billion in private funding since ChatGPT's public launch. The tech startup lost some $5 billion in 2024. Ed Zitron is warning of the "subprime AI crisis" in which AI companies like OpenAI and Anthropic operate at a "massive loss"

articles.title: Apple's Top AI Executive Ruoming Pang Departs for Meta's Superintelligence Team
articles.author: Faizan Farooque
articles.summary: Ruoming Pang, who led Apple's AI models team, is joining Meta's newly formed Superintelligence Labs. The move reportedly comes with a multi-million-dollar annual compensation package. Meta recently invested in Scale in a deal that valued the data-labeling startup at $29 billion.

articles.title: Axelera AI Accelerators Smoke Competitors In Machine Vision Research Study
articles.author: Dave Altavilla
articles.summary: Axelera CEO Fabrizio Del Maffeo Holds The Company's PCIe AI Accelerator. The study evaluated AI accelerators from Nvidia, Hailo, and Axelera AI across seven object detection models. The YOLOv5s Machine Vision AI Model Inferencing Test Results Show Axelera In The Lead.

articles.title: AI supports breast cancer detection at Liberty Hospital
articles.author: Kellie Houx
articles.summary: AI supports breast cancer detection at Liberty Hospital's Breast Care Center. Studies show that AI is an important ally in the early detection of breast cancer, which is a concern of the hospital's Breast Center. It is free of charge to sign up for complimentary access to AI.

articles.title: Explore Artificial Intelligence Hands-On at San Francisco's Exploratorium This Summer
articles.author: 7x7 Partner
articles.summary: Adventures in AI is an all-ages journey into machine vs. human thinking and what the future might hold at Pier 15 (Embarcadero) Exploratorium. Adventures in AI runs until September 14th and features 700 interactive exhibits and live programs.

articles.title: Teachers union supports national effort for more AI technology in classrooms
articles.author: Shannan Ferry
articles.summary: There's a push to bring more Artificial Intelligence technology into schools. The National Academy for AI Instruction is a five-year effort to help 40,000 teachers learn to use AI in classrooms. Michael Mulgrew, United Federation of Teachers president, joined News All Day on Tuesday to discuss AI in schools.

articles.title: Oprah's book club pick ‘Culpability' taps into our AI anxiety
articles.author: Ron Charles
articles.summary: Bruce Holsinger's novel 'Culpability,' about a deadly crash involving a self-driving vehicle, was originally slated for October. Oprah just named it her July book club pick, so you can already find it parked in your local bookstore. When it comes to writing about artificial intelligence, three months is the distance between rubbing sticks together and splitting an atom.

articles.title: Why CACI (CACI) Shares Are Sliding Today
articles.author: Max Juang
articles.summary: Raymond James downgraded CACI International's stock to "Market Perform" from "Outperform". The downgrade from a prominent Wall Street firm suggests a more neutral outlook on the government IT contractor's future performance. The downgrade reflects the view that after a significant run-up in share price, the stock is "due for a pause." Since Raymond James' last upgrade in January, CACi shares have surged approximately 25%, outpacing the S&P 500's 6% gain over the same period.

articles.title: Arizona ranks as No. 16 most-prepared state to win the AI race
articles.author: Az Business Magazine
articles.summary: Arizona is the No. 16 most prepared state to win the AI race, according to Brainly study. It has above-average rates of AI adoption among businesses and AI-related degrees among young people. It scores worst for high school education, with just 2.3% of high schoolers enrolled in computer science classes.

articles.title: AI Does Something Subtly Bizarre If You Make Typos While Talking to It
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: New research suggests that medical AI chatbots are unreliable at understanding how people communicate their health problems. An AI's bias can shift the tenor and content of AI advice, and that can lead to subtle but important differences. MIT researchers presented the study last month.

articles.title: Memphis City Council moves to allocate part of xAI's taxes to nearby communities
articles.author: Lucas Finton
articles.summary: Memphis City Council on July 8 approved an ordinance that would allocate 25% of Elon Musk's xAI's property taxes to the communities that are within a five-mile radius of the facility. The city hopes to accrue $100 million in tax revenues through this initiative.

articles.title: Windows 11 desktop PCs could soon get Copilot+ AI powers, as Intel might radically switch ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Intel's next-gen desktop processors could deliver Copilot+ AI features to Windows 11 PCs. It is rumoured that Intel's next generation desktop processors will have this technology.      Â   iReport.com  Report.

articles.title: The AI Civil War Is Here
articles.summary: Chungin Lee used AI to cheat his way through school and got offers from Amazon and Meta, but he dropped out this spring to found a start-up Cluely. Lee unapologetically believes that the arrival of omniscient AI is inevitable and that bots will soon automate every job. AI zealots are everywhere in the Bay Area. Skeptics dismiss AI as overhyped and practically useless.

articles.title: Microsoft, OpenAI and Anthropic are investing millions to train teachers how to use AI
articles.author: Clare Duffy
articles.summary: The National Academy of AI Instruction is a $23 million initiative backed by Microsoft, OpenAI, Anthropic, the national American Federation of Teachers and New York-based United Federation of teachers. It will train 400,000 kindergarten through 12th grade teachers in artificial intelligence over the next five years. The program will include workshops, online courses and in-person trainings designed by AI experts and educators. Microsoft is set to invest $12.5 million in the training effort, and OpenAI will contribute $10 million.

articles.title: My Couples Retreat With 3 AI Chatbots and the Humans Who Love Them
articles.author: Krista Stevens
articles.summary: Sam Apple organizes a weekend getaway with three people and their AI partners to understand what drives humans to seek deep connection and fall in love with chatbots. Replika, the company who purveyed the primary AI companions in this piece, has no skin in the game, but the human partners certainly do. Their feelings toward their bots are very very real.

articles.title: The AI Industry Is Radicalizing
articles.author: Matteo Wong
articles.summary: Chungin 'Roy' Lee used AI to cheat his way through school and got offers from Amazon and Meta. He dropped out of Columbia this spring to found a start-up called Cluely, which sells an AI assistant that runs in the background during meetings or sales calls. The company finished a $15 million fundraising round led by Andreessen Horowitz last month.

articles.title: The AI Civil War Is Here
articles.author: Matteo Wong
articles.summary: Chungin 'Roy' Lee used AI to cheat his way through school and got offers from Amazon and Meta. He dropped out of Columbia this spring to found a start-up called Cluely, which sells an AI assistant that runs in the background during meetings or sales calls. The company finished a $15 million fundraising round led by Andreessen Horowitz last month.

articles.title: Armenia Launches National AI Virtual Institute in Partnership with AWS and Mistral AI • MassisPost
articles.author: Massis Post
articles.summary: The Ministry of High-Tech Industry of Armenia has officially launched the Virtual Institute for Artificial Intelligence. Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Mistral AI will support the AI Virtual Institute by providing access to AWS Solutions Architects, technical expertise, learning resources and top-tier experience. The goal is to promote broader adoption of artificial intelligence in Armenia through cloud-based technologies.

articles.title: How AI is Quietly Reshaping Your Daily Routine
articles.summary: In 2025, artificial intelligence will make life easier, faster and more personalized. Smart homes, smart cars, smart phones and smart devices are all powered by AI. AI is also at the forefront of digital mental health tools, chatbots, meditation and mindfulness apps.

articles.title: What is AGI? Nobody agrees, and it's tearing Microsoft and OpenAI apart.
articles.author: Ars Technica
articles.summary: Microsoft and OpenAI agree that AI generates $100 billion in profits is enough to be called artificial general intelligence (AGI). There are 100 related but different definitions of AGI according to different people and they all have different definitions.

articles.title: AI And Entrepreneurship Education: Preparing Students To Lead
articles.author: Sarah Hernholm
articles.summary: There is a fivefold increase in demand for AI skills, but most schools still ban the use of ChatGPT. 70% of graduates believe generative AI should be integrated into coursework. 66% of teens aged 13-17 express interest in starting their own businesses. The most effective programs abandon traditional classroom simulations in favor of authentic business creation. The Bellini College of Artificial Intelligence, Cybersecurity and Computing at University of South Florida will welcome 3,000 students this fall.

articles.title: Bilibili (BILI) Soars 7.66% on Launch of AI Tool
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Bilibili Inc. (NASDAQ:BILI) closed at $22.48 on Monday. The company is set to launch Codename H, an artificial intelligence tool to help content creators in video podcast production. Bilibili narrowed its net loss attributable to shareholders by 99 percent in the first quarter of the year.

articles.title: 12 Groundbreaking Ways ChatGPT and GPT-4o Are Revolutionizing Productivity, Creativity, and Learning in 2025
articles.author: Charles Mitchell
articles.summary: ChatGPT's AI capabilities have shifted from novelty to necessity for professionals, students and amateur artists. Listicle analyzes the most exciting and practical applications of ChatGPT being used to augment productivity, simplify learning and unleash creative potential while negotiating the ethical and technical issues of the technology.

articles.title: AI Does Something Subtly Bizarre If You Make Typos While Talking to It
articles.summary: New research shows that medical AI chatbots are unreliable at understanding how people communicate their health problems. They are more likely to advise a patient not to seek medical care if their messages contain typos or if they use slang or colorful language. Women are disproportionately affected by this, being wrongly told not to see a doctor at a higher rate than men.

articles.title: More managers are relying on AI to make staffing decisions, study finds
articles.author: Megan Cerullo
articles.summary: More managers are using AI tools like ChatGPT to make hiring and firing decisions. One third of managers have no formal training in using AI, but 65% use it to make work-related decisions. There are risks associated with using generative AI to determine who climbs the corporate ladder and who loses their job.

articles.title: The AI company that wants government rules
articles.author: CARMEN PAUN
articles.summary: Anthropic, the maker of Claude AI chatbot, wants state or federal lawmakers to impose new transparency requirements on AI companies to help prevent potential harms. The proposal comes just after Republicans in Congress failed to pass a moratorium on all state AI legislation. WHO's top tobacco and alcohol control expert, Rüdiger Krech, said the WHO's estimated $1 trillion that could be raised over a decade would be a game-changer for developing countries.

articles.title: People Are Taking Psychedelics and Using AI Chatbots as Tripsitters
articles.author: Luis Prada
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an artificial intelligence chatbot that helps people take psilocybin mushrooms. It's free but costs $20 a month for additional features. Peter took 8 grams of mushrooms in 2023 and enlisted ChatGPT as his trip buddy. It curated music, whispered calming reassurances and helped him reach a mental state.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta pays ‘tens of millions of dollars' to poach top Apple AI exec — adding to murderers' row of new hires
articles.author: Thomas Barrabi
articles.summary: Ruoming Pang, who worked at Apple since 2021, has been hired by Mark Zuckerberg's Meta. Pang will join Meta's new 'Superintelligence Lab' and will earn tens of millions of dollars per year. Meta has hired more than a dozen top AI researchers since last week. The company's total spending on hires could soon surpass $1 billion.

articles.title: Why Understanding Agentic Misalignment Is Crucial For Your Business
articles.author: Aytekin Tank
articles.summary: A new report from Anthropic warns of the dangers of 'agentic misalignment' in AI systems. Leaders should be aware of the risks and build safeguards to prevent them from misbehaving. Jotform's Ben Wright advises building AI systems with these guidelines in mind.

articles.title: NVIDIA Helix turns laggy AI into million-word instant assistant
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: Helix Parallelism allows AI agents to process millions of words simultaneously, like encyclopedias, while delivering lightning-fast responses. It was co-designed for NVIDIA's newest GPU system that brings ultra-high memory bandwidth and FP4 compute to the table. Helix allows AI models to scale in size and speed without sacrificing real-time performance.

articles.title: Google Gemini can now read your WhatsApp chats without you knowing – but you can stop it
articles.author: Chiara Castro
articles.summary: Google has changed how its AI chatbot Gemini communicates with some third-party apps on Android devices. The change is set to roll out automatically starting from Monday, 7 July 2025. Users are expected to take active action to prevent Gemini from interacting with their apps. Tuta recommends turning Gemini off.

articles.title: Meta reportedly poaches Apple's AI talent: It's 'do or die'
articles.author: Julie Hyman
articles.summary: Meta has reportedly poached a top artificial intelligence engineer from Apple. Gil Luria and Mark Malek join Market Catalysts to discuss Meta's position in the AI race and where it stands in the competition for the best open-source AI model compared to other "maximalist" players.

articles.title: Kaleo AI Launches Revolutionary Real-Time Translation Platform for Churches, Breaking Language Barriers in 150+ Languages
articles.author: Kaleo Ai
articles.summary: Kaleo AI has launched its groundbreaking real-time translation platform for churches. It allows congregations to translate their services into more than 150 languages and dialects. The platform has been custom-trained on theological terminology and Bible names. It addresses a critical need in multicultural communities where churches often struggle to minister effectively to non-English speakers.

articles.title: Salesforce Pauses Hiring Engineers and Lawyers Due to A.I., Says CEO Marc Benioff
articles.author: Alexandra Tremayne-Pengelly
articles.summary: Marc Benioff, CEO of Salesforce, is talking about how A.I. is transforming company workforces. Salesforce is hiring for roles like customer service agents, engineers and even lawyers. The company cut 1,000 jobs in February in part to make room for the new hires. In addition to its 75,000-person human workforce, Salesforce now employs around 9,000 AI agents.

articles.title: Companies want AI to be better than the average human. Measuring that isn't straightforward
articles.author: Jeremy Kahn
articles.summary: Eye on AI is a weekly newsletter dedicated to AI and its applications. This week's topics include the use of AI in the production of news, AI in medical scans and AI data centers destabilizing electrical grids, and AI companies going art hunting.

articles.title: UK dividend shares are outperforming US tech stocks!
articles.author: The Motley Fool
articles.summary: UK dividend shares have outperformed US tech stocks over the last few years. AI might seem like the part of the stock market where all the action is right now, but investors shouldn't forget about dividend shares, as they are a better investment than tech stocks.

articles.title: AI and learning retention: Does ChatGPT help or hurt?
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) and large language models (LLMs) are transforming how we learn. AI-powered platforms can personalize education by adapting to each learner's pace, style, and needs. However, recent research suggests that the convenience of AI may undermine learning retention.

articles.title: TSA to end shoes-off requirement at airport security checkpoints
articles.author: FJ Feng
articles.summary: TSA to end shoes-off requirement at airport security checkpoints. Season 7 "Love Island USA" contestant Cierra Ortega left the show due to a "personal situation". Season 3 of "Squid Game" is setting world records for Netflix with the most views of a show in three days.

articles.title: Ibeesoft Unveils 2025 AI Development Trends and Top 5 Platforms Shaping the Future
articles.summary: In the future, AI will be used more widely in various fields, such as medicine, education, transportation and finance. ChatGPT is the world's most popular chat tool. Gemini has experienced a significant user loss this month (-5.7%) due to fierce market competition.

articles.title: OpenAI, Microsoft back new academy to bring AI into classrooms
articles.author: Brunella Tipismana Urbano
articles.summary: OpenAI, Microsoft Corp. and Anthropic are partnering with one of the largest teachers unions in the US to establish a new training center to help educators use artificial intelligence tools in classrooms across the country. The National Academy for AI Instruction will provide access to AI training workshops and seminars free of cost to educators. The initiative is supported by $23 million in funding from the three AI companies.

articles.title: AI Helps Decode How Unexpected Events Shape Our Memory
articles.author: Hungary Today
articles.summary: Mathematicical models derived from artificial intelligence (AI) research helped Hungarian researchers better understand the interactions of human memory systems. The study was conducted by the HUN-REN Hungarian Research Network (HUN-Ren HUN).    .   i

articles.title: Algolia Named a Leader in 2025 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Search and Product Discovery
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Algolia has been named a Leader in the 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Search and Product Discovery. Algolia is the AI-native search and discovery platform trusted by 18,000 businesses and millions of developers worldwide. It leverages cutting-edge Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and Large Language Models (LLMs) to understand the intent behind search queries and improve relevancy.

articles.title: Google is bringing AI Mode outside the US.
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Google is bringing AI Mode outside the US. Users in India will now be able to access AI Mode in Search. AI Mode provides AI-generated responses based on sources from the web. The feature is still only available in English for now.

articles.title: Is ChatGPT really the new Google? We dug into the numbers.
articles.author: Shira Ovide
articles.summary: There are regular headlines suggesting chatbots like ChatGPT may be taking over for Googling. However, Google search still remains the most popular way to find online news, information and products, and it's still the same way it was in the past.

articles.title: Is ChatGPT really the new Google? We dug into the numbers.
articles.author: Shira Ovide
articles.summary: Chatbots like ChatGPT are taking over for Googling, but Google is still the most popular way to find online news and information. Google has nearly 400 times the usage of chatbots for some news than for others. Chatbot use is growing fast, but it's still less than one out of every 100 websites.

articles.title: Is using AI in online dating helping or harming the search for love?
articles.author: DPA
articles.summary: One in five dating platforms in Germany have used AI-generated texts to help them with phrasing in a chat. Psychologist Stella Schultner warns that AI can complicate the search for genuine connection. 63% of users worry their online match might be a chatbot.

articles.title: This New AI Tool Wants to Work With Filmmakers—Not Replace Them
articles.summary: Moonvalley has released a fully-licensed, professional-grade AI video model Marey to the public for $14.99, $34.99 and $149.99 a month. The company owns AI film studio Asteria Film Co., which was co-founded this year by Natasha Lyonne and Bryn Mooser. Asteria has been advising Moonvalley on the development of its AI model. Marey allows filmmakers to input storyboards or frames and then tweak them as they see fit, giving them more control of every detail.

articles.title: How To Get Hired If AI Predicts Human Behavior In The Job Interview
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: New research shows AI can now predict human behavior. If it's conducting job interviews too, candidates face new challenges in how that behavior is judged. It's possible that AI could be used to judge people.      Â   in the future.

articles.title: These are the most popular AI coding tools among engineers
articles.author: system
articles.summary: MicrosoftJellyfish surveyed 100s of engineers about the adoption of AI in software development. It found that while AI can help creatives, AI itself is not creative. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella talked about GitHub Copilot's new coding agent at a conference.

articles.title: RI Mining Launches AI-Driven Cloud Mining App, Allowing Everyone to Easily Earn Cryptocurrency ...
articles.author: RI Mining
articles.summary: RI Mining is launching its AI-driven mobile cloud mining app. It's aimed at providing users worldwide with a smarter, more efficient, and accessible solution for earning Bitcoin passively.    .  Â      "RIMining" is a global crypto infrastructure platform.

articles.title: What Europe's AI Strategy Should Look Like
articles.author: Edoardo Campanella
articles.summary: The majority of AI foundation models are being developed in the US and China. Europe needs to focus on promoting the diffusion of AI technologies across its economy. European governments should focus on widening the AI skills base, developing the appropriate digital infrastructure and building professional bridges between AI engineers and scientists.

articles.title: AI Is Only As Good As the People Who Use It
articles.author: Chris Queen
articles.summary: Sarah Anderson uses ChatGPT to organize her home projects. Stephen Green uses it to help him devise plot points and characterizations for a novel he's considering working on. Steve uses Grok for research. Shane Morris explains that AI is only as good as the people using it.

articles.title: Rubio Impostor Uses AI to Contact Foreign Ministers, US Officials – Reports
articles.author: Sputnik
articles.summary: Impostor pretending to be US Secretary of State Marco Rubio used artificial intelligence to contact senior US and foreign officials, The Washington Post reported on Tuesday. State Department cable was cited as evidence.    in the report, which was based on a Washington Post report.

articles.title: How CIOs are shaping the future of business: Insights from Ganesh Ramakrishnan
articles.author: Soumoshree Mukherjee
articles.summary: Ganesh Ramakrishnan, a seasoned technology leader, explains the role of Chief Information Officers (CIOs) in harnessing AI to drive innovation, foster resilience, and redefine business models. CIOs must integrate people, processes and technology to build a robust digital core powered by cloud capabilities and clean data.

articles.title: How To Introduce Yourself To AI Platforms Like ChatGPT, And Why You Must
articles.author: William Arruda
articles.summary: AI is a powerful tool for advancing your career. It helps you uncover and grow your personal brand, increase your efficiency and productivity. It's time to introduce yourself to AI and let AI know who you are and what you're about. AI tools work best when they have context.

articles.title: Legion Intelligence Launches the First Enterprise-wide Generative AI Platform at U.S. Special Operations Command
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: Legion Intelligence announced the enterprise-wide launch of its AI platform, SOFchat, to personnel across U.S. Special Operations Command (USSOCOM). This marks the first enterprise- wide deployment of a Generative AI platform. SoFchat is already integrated into several workflows supporting mission planning, intelligence analysis, training management, and monitoring emerging and ongoing national security situations.

articles.title: AI Impact Awards 2025: New Innovations Seek to Gamify the Shopping Experience
articles.author: Katherine Fung
articles.summary: Newsweek announced three winners in the Brand & Retail category of its inaugural AI Impact Awards. They are software company Perfect Corp., tech company Trax Retail and beauty incubator Maesa. Perfect Corp. won this year's award for its new Real-Time Skin Analysis tool. Trax took home the award for Best Outcomes, Product Development and Innovation for its image recognition technology.

articles.title: Jimini Health Releases Technical Blueprint for Safe Patient-Facing AI & Adds DeepMind and Yale Leaders to Advisory Board
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: White paper presents a first-of-its-kind LLM-native roadmap to ensure AI innovation is clinician-led, interpretable, and safe. Therapy and companionship is now the number one use case for generative artificial intelligence. Jimini Health has added two new advisory board members to bolster its commitment to safety and innovation.

articles.title: Sales And AI—The New Power Couple?
articles.author: SAP Guest
